Case reference: 2020007369.CaseDesc: On October 14, 1981, at approximately 9:00pm, May Mah was last seen by her nurse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2012020064.CaseDesc: On June 24, 2000, Irma Murdock was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. It is believed that Irma may have travelled to Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2000000183.CaseDesc: Matthew was last seen at a truck stop in Sicamous in British Columbia, Canada.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2012020650.CaseDesc: On February 11, 2007, Danita Bigeagle was seen for the last time near the 800 block of Victoria Avenue in Regina, Saskatchewan. Danita is known to frequent the city’s downtown area, and she rarely leaves Regina.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Quilted parka with drawstring waist
Tattoo: Left Hand, Happy face and the letter "d" on the web of her left hand

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2021018406.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in a tent in a wooded area south of the fire station located on 95 Sandalwood Parkway East in Brampton, Ontario. He was found with two pairs of reading glasses and a lighter.

Underwear: Boxer briefs; size: medium: black waistband; brand: YellowTag
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Wrist, Poorly healed fracture of right wrist

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2014006193.CaseDesc: At approximately 7:30 a.m. on July 11, 2013, Randy George was dropped off on Hwy #21 near the north side of the Big Island Lake Cree Territory, SK. He was last seen walking north on the highway. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. George since that time.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that Mr. Bhattarai’s last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge, Edmonton. Mr. Bhattarai’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2016053812.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2016, at approximately 2:30 a.m., Van Pham was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020021.CaseDesc: Madison Scott went missing in 2011. She was at a party in the early morning hours of May 28th at Hogsback Lake, and was to camp there overnight. In the morning her friends found her tent and her pickup truck, but Maddy was nowhere to be found. Her purse was found in the truck but her phone and keys were missing. When Maddy didn't return home her parents became worried and reported her missing.

Case reference: 2019050942.CaseDesc: On August 16, 2019, Aaron Wuttunee was seen for the last time in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. During the time of his disappearance, Aaron had mentioned to an acquaintance that he may hitchhike to Edmonton, Alberta. There is also a possibility that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia, but it has not been confirmed. Aaron is known for leading a transient lifestyle, and suffered from a brain injury that causes short term memory loss and makes him prone to falling.

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joesph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Mr. Arcand has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001731.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1987, Russell Atkinson was last seen boarding a Greyhound bus in Penticton, British Columbia. The bus was destined for Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Russell did not arrive in Winnipeg but his luggage was found on the bus.

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Hair: Brown, Red, Straight, Hair is shaved around sides and back with medium length section on the top
Pierce: Ears, 3 piercings on the right side and 1 on the left

Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2014005701.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2011, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Dezso Junaszka was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go to work in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Denim, Blue, Brown, Large white logo on the back and left breast "UNK"
Shoes: White, Running, Running shoes; possibly "Puma" brand

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Hair: Blonde, Sometimes worn in a "Mohawk" style
Jewelry: Wood, Nametag with the inscription of "Woody"

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2012003499.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Tim Maletic left his family residence in Kitchener, Ontario. He left a note saying he was going to Toronto and has not been heard from since. Mr. Maletic also has ties to the Windsor, Ontario area.

Backpack: Blue, Red, Adidas, Blue with red trim

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2018056491.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1994, at approximately 6:15pm, Gallus Huber was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Gallus was scheduled to attend a language class but did not show up.

Case reference: 2018020022.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1968, Jacqueline Lefebvre was last seen while she was at the family cottage in Mascouche, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing

Case reference: 2014005046.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2007, at approximately 3:45 p.m., Remi Bouchard was seen for the last time on a floatation device in the Bow River near Calgary, Alberta. Remi disappeared into the water after being trapped at the base of the weir.

Case reference: 2016068946.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1972, the body of a male was found washed up on the shore of the Municipal Beach, in St. Catharines. It is believed that he had been in the water for only a few hours prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014003823.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1996, Patricia Ferguson was seen for the last time in the Pointe-aux-Trembles district of Montreal, Quebec. That night, Patricia had slept at a friend's place but had left the apartment, without her young daughter. She left a note saying she was going out for breakfast, and then meeting her sister. Patricia has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring
Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area

Case reference: 2014002814.CaseDesc: On December 17, 1983, Guy Turgeon was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Rosemont-La-Petite-Patrie District in Montreal, Quebec. He was despondent and suffered from mental health issues. Guy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael Milavanov.

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2014002284.CaseDesc: Richard Reitmeier has not been heard from or seen since the fall of 1988. There is not much known surrounding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Kiani speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m.. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2022010303.CaseDesc: On January 6, 2022, Jeannine Ermineskin was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta’s downtown area.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Love eagle feather lady with headdress
Right Upper Arm , Crown diamond flower stars (feathers)
Left Upper Arm, Eagle female face (rose)
Right Hand, The word "LOVE" on knuckles

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim
Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs

Case reference: 2013000123.CaseDesc: The remains of a middle-aged man was discovered in a bush area in Beacon Hill Park in Victoria, British Columbia on July 18, 1988. He had grey hair and long sideburns or a beard. It appears the man died within a month from when he was found.

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2019044701.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2019, at approximately 6:00 am, Bridget Dalbe was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2014002353.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1978, two men found a racing canoe and reported the incident to police. During the resulting investigation it was discovered there were two men in the canoe who apparently were going out to dig for Seneca root. According to witnesses who observed the men leave; indicated they left in adverse weather conditions which included high winds. Mr. Buck has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2019073733.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, Trevor Batoche was seen for the last time in Penticton, British Columbia. Trevor was known to frequently travel to Northern British Columbia and Edmonton, Alberta, possibly driving an older black pickup truck.

Case reference: 2007005299.CaseDesc: Shelley Mathieu-Read resided in Sarnia, Ontario. She was last seen on May 20, 2007 in Sarnia but has not been heard from since. An extensive investigation by the Sarnia Police Service has failed to locate her.

Scar: Forehead, from hairline running down into forhead
Tattoo: Right Foot, graphic of a star

Case reference: 2022060389.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2021, Pitseolak Pootoogook was seen for the last time in Kinngait, Nunavut. During the time of his disappearance, Pitseolak was seen walking on the ice towards the mountains.

Case reference: 2014007309.CaseDesc: On August 20, 1997, a canoeist found a human skull on the Moose Jaw River, just south of Moose Jaw, SK. The skull was examined by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the skull had been exposed to the elements for 50 to 100 years. It was that of a 12 year old, possibly Caucasian, female. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014004260.CaseDesc: Louis Valentine was last seen in August 2000 with friends in Laval, Quebec. Louis, a former resident of Laval, had won a large sum of money in the lottery in December 1999 and the following month he moved to Trois-Rivières.

Case reference: 2005000299.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2005, the remains of a female were found in a wooded location at an MTO picnic area on Highway #7 west of Rockwood, Ontario. It is believed the female had been dragged a short distance into the woods, beside the picnic area and had been there for approximately a month before being discovered. A "Woods" sleeping bag had been placed over top of the deceased, covering her. No personal jewelry or identification was found with the deceased. The clothing that she wore was found to have been purchased in the Montreal area. Investigators believe the circumstances of her death are suspicious and consider this foul play.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Medium length, reddish brown
Teeth: 2 missing upper teeth on the left front and wore a two-tooth partial plate.
Shirt: Beige, Atmosphere, Tank Top, size 10/12, round neck
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Abdomen, left 7th rib of the front rib cage.
Left Cheek, old facial trauma including left eye socket
Nose, Old facial trauma including a broken nose

Case reference: 2014001124.CaseDesc: The skeletal skull of a young middle-aged woman was found by a hunter on September 10, 1994, in a wooded area east of Golden, British Columbia. She may have had a dental overlap at the front and would have died about 5 years earlier.

Case reference: 2014005913.CaseDesc: Douglas Bender was last seen in the North End area of Winnipeg. He is known to frequent the downtown area. It is uncharacteristic for Mr. Bender not to be in contact with his family.

Jacket: Grey, Brown, Winter/parka with fur-trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2006020399.CaseDesc: Lawrence Prettie was last seen on October 23, 1994. His boat capsized on Lac Seul and he is presumed drowned. His body has never been recovered.  His boat, camping and fishing gear were located strewn about on an island in Lac Seul.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2015027786.CaseDesc: On May, 28, 2015, Jessica Heppner was reported missing by a friend and travelling companion. Jessica was visiting St. John's Newfoundland and was staying at the Sheraton Hotel. She was known to utilize Taxi Cabs as a mode of transportation. She never returned to the hotel to get her belongings.

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014002041.CaseDesc: Sometime over the night of November 19 to 20, 1999, Mathieu Parent was seen for the last time leaving the Dagobert night club in Quebec, Quebec. His family has not heard from him since.

Shoes: Blue, Yellow, With fluorescent yellow lines
Pants: Nylon, Dark Blue, With white lines on the sides
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, Fubu, Long sleeves

Case reference: 2021042160.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Darren Werner was last seen at his residence in the town Niagara-on-the-Lake in Ontario. It is possible that Darren had gotten into an unknown vehicle.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020007336.CaseDesc: On December 16, 1970, Abraham Wolfson was seen for the last time leaving a law office in Toronto, Ontario. Abraham had left with certificates worth $50,000 and had come into the city to arrange the sale of a property. Despite the offer of a reward from Abraham’s family, there has been no information pertaining to his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2006022999.CaseDesc: Spike Jorgenson was last seen crossing Chief Bay, Lake Nipigon in a canoe on September 28, 1973. It is believed that his canoe capsized, and he is presumed drowned.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, at the second joint

Case reference: 2018027693.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, at around 8:30 am, Diane Mae Bignell was last seen on Juniper Street in Thompson, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front
Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2013000115.CaseDesc: Gaby Luonga Kombe was last seen on August 23, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec. He had to go to Pie-IX metro station to meet a friend. Later in the evening, he called his son to tell him he was heading home. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018041254.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2018, Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house, on foot, in North Battleford, Saskatchewan

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.
